Description.en: All players must immediately play a \stn{} card.
All players holding at least one \btr{} must raise their hands. You may swap any held \stn{} of yours for a \btr{} of their choice.
All players must immediately reveal their \textbf{Cacophony} cards. If there are 3 or fewer other \textbf{Cacophony} cards revealed, gain that many \pnts{}. Otherwise, discard all your \act{} cards.
All other players discard 2 \act{} cards. If \textbf{Joy} is in play, double this effect.
You may play 3 \act{} cards immediately. If \textbf{Misery} has been played this round, you may play 3 \act{} cards immediately instead.
Cancel the effects of another player's \act{}.

Instant.en: At any point while a player is playing an \act{}.

Description.en: You may look at the \act{} draw deck. You may order it or shuffle it in any way you wish before putting it back.
All players holding at least one \brg{} must raise their hands. You may swap any held \stn{} of yours with a \brg{} of their choice.
You may swap two of your played \stn{} cards.
Choose any player who must reveal their held \stn{} cards to everyone, then give that player this \textbf{Burning Truth} card instead of discarding it.
Negate that effect. The player must also discard all their \act{} cards.

Instant.en: If a player tries to take or swap any of your held cards.

Description.en: All other players must discard 2 \act{} cards.
You may look at the played \stn{} cards of any one other player.
While this card is in effect, no \act{} cards may be drawn.
Remove \textbf{Famine} from play. Draw as many \act{} cards as there are players, then give each player one card of your choosing.
Remove all persistent \act{} cards from play.
You may turn any of your own played \stn{} cards face-up.
While you hold this card, you may not play any other \act{} cards.

If another player has \textbf{Love}, they may reveal it and discard it, and you both gain 2 \pnts{}. Only the first player to reveal will gain \pnts{}. If no player reveals \textbf{Love}, you lose 2 \pnts{}.
All players must give you one of their \act{} cards, of their choosing.
All players, including yourself, must reveal one of their played \stn{} cards and then return it to their hand.
You may pick the card up and play it yourself immediately afterwards.

Instant.en: If an \act{} allows a player to take cards from your hand
